questions.question_text: A steering committee established to oversee an organization's digital transformation program is MOST likely to be involved with which of the following activities?

Following an internal audit of a database, management has committed to enhance password management controls. Which of the following provides the BEST evidence that management has remediated the audit finding?

choices.D: Observation of updated password settings with database administrators (DBAs)
choices.C: Change tickets of recent password configuration updates
choices.A: Screenshots from end users showing updated password settings
choices.B: Interviews with management about remediation completion

discussion.content:
From CISA Review Questions, Answers and Explanations Manual 12th Edition, Question A4-80 Observation is the best and most effective method to test changes to ensure that the process is effectively designed.
The answer is D. Observation of updated password settings
Note that a report generated from the system directly by the auditor as an evidence is better than observation because the report is more objective than observation.

Selected Answer: D
Surely observation of the settings/configuration is better.

Selected Answer: D
If the question is about best evidence, then direct verification on the system in option D. is better than just logging a change in a ticket (C.) . In terms of database systems, password configurations are typically a database administration task while password configurations with end-user access - even if it is read-only - are more typical in the PC/desktop area. Interviews with management (B.) are certainly not the best evidence, as their information again only reflects what they are told by their employees. Therefore, my bet is on D. Observation of updated password with database administrators.

Selected Answer: C
By reviewing the ticket content of recent password updates, it is possible to determine the nature of the remedial action adopted by management.

Selected Answer: C
The BEST evidence lies in C. Change tickets of recent password configuration updates. These change tickets provide a documented trail of actions taken by management to enhance password security. By reviewing these records, auditors can verify that the necessary changes were implemented and that password policies were strengthened.

Selected Answer: C
Change tickets are formal records that document changes made to a system or its configuration. In this case, change tickets specifically related to password configuration updates would demonstrate that management has taken action to enhance password management controls. The change tickets would provide a clear trail of the changes made, including details such as the date, time, and individuals involved in the password configuration updates.

Selected Answer: D
Observation is the best and most effective method

Selected Answer: D
Continuous risk management: The CISA material emphasizes that risk management is an ongoing process requiring periodic reassessment to address environmental changes, new threats, and evolving security requirements1. This aligns with the cyclical nature of the risk management life cycle (identification, assessment, mitigation, monitoring), which is depicted as iterative rather than phase-limited.
Options A, B, and C are phase-specific and inconsistent with the emphasis on continuous monitoring in the CISA framework. The material rejects one-time or phase-bound risk assessments in favor of a lifecycle approach.

Selected Answer: D
This aligns with the principle that risk management is an iterative process requiring continuous monitoring and adaptation to evolving risks. Key reasons supporting this choice include: Continuous Monitoring: New risks may emerge at any stage (e.g., design, execution, closure), and existing risks may change in impact or likelihood. A one-time update during specific phases (Options A, B, or C) would fail to address dynamic risk environments. 
Proactive Mitigation: Regular updates enable timely adjustments to risk responses, reducing the likelihood of project delays or failures.

Alignment with Standards: Best practices, such as those outlined in frameworks like PMBOK or ISO 31000, emphasize that risk registers should be updated iteratively across all project phases.

choices.C: At the end of each phase of the project
choices.A: During the design phase of the project
choices.B: During the planning phase of the project
choices.D: Throughout the lifetime of the project
